top_categories.workout_context: Vermont Overland’s vermont pavé (7 sectors rough roads), technical climbs demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Vermont Overland isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Vermont Overland when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Vermont Overland rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Vermont Overland — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Vermont Overland’s 7,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Vermont Overland’s vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Vermont Overland. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Vermont Overland — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads.
Vermont Overland’s vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Vermont Overland count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Vermont Overland’s 7,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Vermont Overland’s 54 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Vermont Overland demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: vermont pavé (7 sectors rough roads), technical climbs, gravel and dirt roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 54 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Over Under to prepare you for 54 miles of vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads in Woodstock, Vermont.
